result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on November 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

09:44 AM Defendant Joel R Pugh in court with attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. Victim(s) appear in court in person. 

Judge Carter is covering hearing for Judge Dorow. 

Atty Jensen did receive global offer from the State last week, and requests another date to send a counter offer to the State and to review discovery. Court sets. 

  Hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on August 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:10 AM Defendant Joel R Pugh in court with attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has discovery but not an offer.  State to provide offer to defense.  Court sets matter for another status date.  Hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.

08:23 AM Defendant Joel R Pugh in court with attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.

Hearing on May 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Hearing on May 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.  Defendant to have no contact with victim A & B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.
